data.text: @NaliniKate hi Nalini if the system times out because you take longer than an hour to complete your submission then you'll need to start it again. It doesn't save uncompleted submissions.

The deadline for our Open Call script submission opportunity is today, Wednesday 7th December, at noon. No Late Submissions Will Be Accepted! 

Get your submission in now as you may need time to create an account or reset your password on our system.

urls.title: Writer Types: Which one are you?
urls.description: Through his work as a screenwriter, James Capel has noticed different types of writers appearing time and again. He put together this list for us and we want to know, 'Which one are you?'

data.text:

Take a look and see which ones apply to you! https://t.co/6AUjaeviWM

urls.title: Join our Cloud HD Video Meeting
urls.description: Zoom is the leader in modern enterprise video communications, with an easy, reliable cloud platform for video and audio conferencing, chat, and webinars across mobile, desktop, and room systems. Zoom Rooms is the original software-based conference room solution used around the world in board, conference, huddle, and training rooms, as well as executive offices and classrooms. Founded in 2011, Zoom helps businesses and organizations bring their teams together in a frictionless environment to get more done. Zoom is a publicly traded company headquartered in San Jose, CA.

urls.title: Welcome! You are invited to join a webinar: The Hot House: Panel Discussion. After registering, you will receive a confirmation email about joining the webinar.
urls.description: The Hot House, a development lab for scripted TV and film projects about climate change, will open for submissions on December 1st. Have you thought about writing a script addressing climate change? Join us for a panel event with screenwriter Richie Mehta (Amal, Siddharth, Delhi Crime), BFI Editor at Large Lizzie Francke and Climate Spring director Lucy Stone where they will be discussing the importance of storytelling to combat the climate crisis. The development lab, hosted by BBC, BFI and Climate Spring, offers the opportunity for shortlisted writers to have three months of one on one support to develop their ideas, and to pitch for development funding from Climate Spring. Join us on Wednesday 23rd November, 16:00-17:30 for an online panel event. Learn more about writing for climate change and be the first to find out more about what the Hot House development lab will offer.

tweets.text:

https://t.co/VA2KYAAYfs

urls.title: WRITING ON AIR 2022
urls.description: Writing On Air is back! Writing On Air is a literature festival on the radio. Now in its 8th year, all programmes are conceived and created by upwards of 200 writers, readers, and performers from across Leeds and West Yorkshire, supported by the Chapel FM team.

urls.title: Convergence - Short Circuit
urls.description: Convergence is Short Circuit’s programme aimed at Scotland-based writers and creatives currently working in other mediums who are interested in learning to write for screen. Programme Outline For Convergence 2023, Short Circuit will select up to 10 applicants who will develop their screenwriting skills and industry knowledge through online development workshops, peer group discussions, masterclasses […]

tweets.text:
⏰ The #Convergence deadline is looming!

Our programme, starting in January 2023, will support Scotland-based writers to create a short film screenplay and feature film treatment.

📥 Apply before Sunday 13th November, 11.59pm
🔗 https://t.co/UQv5XMdVYb https://t.co/WykjPoNseE
